III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/25/25, a staff member was juggling oranges outside with
youth. The staff member threw the oranges at the two youth
unprovoked. One youth was hit in the forearm. A youth threw an
orange back and then taunted staff by pretending to throw another
object. The staff member ran at the youth and attempted to kick
the youth in the head. The staff member grabbed an orange and
continued to taunt the youth by pretending to throw it at them.
Investigation Interviews:
Supervisor was interviewed via phone on July 3, 2025.
Supervisor reported he became aware of this concern because
Youth B had reported it to him. He reported he reviewed the video
footage and noted the concerns within the allegations. Supervisor
reported there was a concern that Staff 1 was trying to horseplay with
the youth. He reported Staff 1 is currently on leave pending this
investigation. Supervisor reported when Staff 1 was told she was put
on leave she knew it was because of this situation and asked if she
was going to be fired.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7,
2025. Translator was used for this interview. Youth A reported he
does not like Staff 1 because she plays around too much. He
reported he tries to stay away from her because she will play fight.
Youth A could not remember any specific times when she was play
fighting with him. When asked about the concern about her throwing
oranges, he reported he remembered that situation. Youth A reported
he was working on his bicycle outside when Staff 1 randomly started
throwing oranges at him and Youth B. He reported Staff 1 missed
hitting him with the orange and he threw it back at her. Youth A
reported he then threatened to throw a bike part at her and she came
running up towards him trying to kick him. He reported she never
made contact with him. Youth A reported he was not sure if Staff 1
was playing around or not but he did not like her actions. He reported
staff are not supposed to act like this even if she was playing around.
Youth A reported he had never seen any other staff act like that
before.
2

Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7,
2025. Translator was used for this interview. Youth B reported he
does not like Staff 1 as she hit him in the arm with the orange. When
asked why Staff 1 hit him with an orange, Youth A reported he did
not know why. He reported Staff 1 likes to play around a lot, which is
not an appropriate thing for staff members to do with the youth.
Youth B reported Staff 1 does not know how to appropriately interact
with the youth. He reported when he was hit with the orange it was
with force, and it hurt. Youth B reported he does not remember Staff
1 trying to kick anyone. He reported he does feel safe at the facility
but feels Staff 1 needs to work a different job.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7,
2025. Youth C reported Staff 1 is a nice staff that likes to play around
with the youth. When asked about the incident, he reported he was
reading a book when Staff 1 came outside with three oranges she
was juggling. Youth C reported Youth A and Youth B were in the
driveway of the home working on their bicycles. He reported Staff 1
then threw her three oranges at Youth A and Youth B. Youth C
reported he witnessed Staff 1 hit Youth B with the orange on the arm.
Youth C reported he does not remember her trying to kick Youth A
but does remember Youth A and Youth B did not look happy when
she threw oranges at them. He reported it was a strange situation,
and it appeared Staff 1 was trying to play around with the youth.
Youth C reported staff are not to play around with the youth like that.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on July 7, 2025. Staff 1
reported on June 26, 2025, she came outside of the home to show
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C that she could juggle oranges. She
reported Youth A wanted to juggle the oranges, so she started to
throw them at him, but she did not have a great aim. Staff 1 denied
ever hitting a youth with an orange. This consultant reported that the
video footage was reviewed, which showed Staff 1 hitting Youth B
with an orange and Staff 1 stated she does not remember this
happening. Staff 1 was asked what happened after she went to throw
the oranges; she stated she just went over to pick them up. This
consultant asked Staff 1 if she tried to kick a youth and she denied it.
When told that it was seen on video that she attempted to kick Youth
A in the head after she went to get the oranges, Staff 1 reported she
was just playing around and there was no malicious intent. She
reported Youth A was trying to throw things back at her, so she
thought it was a game. Staff 1 stated this situation was never meant
to be aggressive and she was playing around with the youth. When
asked if she is allowed to play around with the youth like this, she
stated that she is not aware. She reported she is aware of the code
of conduct she signed but is not sure what exactly was on there. Staff
1 reported she had only been at the facility for about three months
3

and stated she did not mean to cause any harm to anyone. She
reported in retrospect she would never have done any of this
behavior as she sees now that it was inappropriate.
Video Recording
Video record of June 26, 2025 during the time of 5:46pm to
5:48pm was reviewed by this consultant. This video footage is
captured outside of the home in the front area. Staff 1 is located
outside with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. Staff 1 has three
oranges in her hands and was juggling oranges while Youth C was
observed sitting looking at a book. Youth A and Youth B were
working on fixing bicycles together. Staff 1 is seen throwing two of
the oranges at Youth A but does not make contact with Youth A’s
body. Staff 1 threw the third orange at Youth B and the orange hits
Youth B’s forearm. Staff 1 appears to be jumping around and in a
positive mood when throwing the oranges. Youth A then threw an
orange back at Staff 1, hitting her with the orange. He then grabs a
bicycle rim and taunts Staff 1 by pretending to throw the bicycle rim
at Staff 1. In response to this, Staff 1 is seen running towards Youth
A and attempting to kick Youth A in the head, but her foot never
made contact with his body. Staff 1 then walks away and picks up the
oranges.
Documents Reviewed
- Facility Staff Code of Conduct Policy- This policy notes
staff will not engage in any physical abuse. Staff will not
engage in any discriminatory treatment or harassment of
anyone. Staff must confine their interactions and/or
relationships with youth to those activities which fall within the
scope of the staff’s job duties.
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 has no disciplinary
actions noted within her HR file. Staff 1 signed the Staff Code
of Conduct policy on April 2, 2025. Staff 1 is up to date on all
required training including a review of the Staff Code of
Conduct on May 3, 2025.
- Facility Incident report dated June 26, 2025, completed by
Supervisor- Supervisor reviewed video footage from June 25,
2025, which showed Staff 1 throwing oranges at Youth A and
Youth B. Youth C had witnessed this occurred. The details in
this incident report are consistent with video footage reviewed
by this consultant. Supervisor noted in the incident report that
Youth B reported this concern on June 26, 2025. The incident
reported noted ORR directed Supervisor to speak with state
licensing about this incident on July 2, 2025, which resulted in
4

them submitting a complaint to be investigated within this
situation.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance of Staff 1 following the
internal policy of the facility’s code of conduct. This policy notes
staff will not engage in any physical abuse. Staff will not engage in
any discriminatory treatment or harassment of anyone. Staff must
confine their interactions and/or relationships with youth to those
activities which fall within the scope of the staff’s job duties. Within
the video and through out interviews, Staff 1 is seen throwing
oranges at the youth and then attempting to kick Youth A in the head.
Even if Staff 1 was trying to horseplay with the youth, it is still against
the facilities code of conduct as she was not conducting herself in a
professional manner.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2025SIC0000198 dated 2/21/25, CAP approved 3/14/25
SIR 2025SIC0000297 dated 2/24/25, CAP approved 3/12/25
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
